snippet: New findings, in simplified form: Short hockey players, defensemen or those who take a lot of penalties have a higher risk of head injuries.
abstract: Slap Shot hockey column; several seasons' worth of data have begun to give researchers an idea of which elite hockey players are more likely to sustain concussions, with short players, defensemen, and penalty-prone players topping list.
lead_paragraph: New findings, in simplified form: Short hockey players, defensemen or those who take a lot of penalties have a higher risk of head injuries.
